title: Create a record from an infrastructure & peripheral asset record
content:
You can create request records from an infrastructure & peripheral asset record to improve the IT asset management process, such as the asset lifecycle management. 

Note Data domain assignments aren't copied when you create a request record from an infrastructure & peripheral asset record. For more information about domains, see Data domain segmentation.

To create a record from an infrastructure & peripheral asset record:

  1. From the main menu, select Build > Service Asset & Configuration.

  2. From SACM Home, select Infrastructure & Peripheral Services.

  3. Click the record identifier in the ID column to display the selected record.

  4. On the toolbar, click and select Create Request from record.

    Service Management displays the correct form to gather the appropriate information for the new record, and automatically fills in common information.

    In this case, the system will synchronize the current information of the infrastructure & peripheral asset record to the new request record.

  5. Enter the details for the new record, and save the record.

    In the request record, the device record appears on the Involved CIs tab, under the Involved infrastructure & peripherals section.
